page.title: 17POPULATION CHANGES,ODDINGLEY
page.content: The population of{Oddingley continued to fall until after the Second World War, but the motor car has made it a more accessible area again. In 1951 the population in { {Martin Hussingtree}rose again.This was due to new housing developments in the area.In the years following this the population fell again. Therefore people must have preferred city life as it was more convenient e.g. for gas, electricity and transport reasons. The population in the other parts of our area are too small and inconsistent to be recorded e.g.{Brownheath}which has a population only just rising into double figures.
